metadata.title: USN-4041-1 -- Linux kernel update
metadata.description: USN-4017-1 fixed vulnerabilities in the Linux kernel for Ubuntu. Unfortunately, the update introduced a regression that interfered with networking applications that setup very low SO_SNDBUF values. This update fixes the problem.  We apologize for the inconvenience.  Jonathan Looney discovered that the Linux kernel could be coerced into segmenting responses into multiple TCP segments. A remote attacker could construct an ongoing sequence of requests to cause a denial of service.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-4041-1` to fix the vulnerability.
